description: The wax gourd (Benincasa hispida) is an amazing multifaceted species of vine-growing squash. Its amazing because of its versatility â€“ it can be eaten as a vegetable and its mature, dried, shell-like rind is used to make containers, various musical instruments, and even to fuel fires. Additionally, its root, stem, leaf and flower are all edible and oftentimes utilized in traditional medicine for treating a variety of ailments. Its sweet flesh can be eaten cooked or raw, plus the gourd also produces a large amount of edible seeds that can be harvested for their high nutrient content. Truly an amazing plant!
